cluster_relations.rel_desc: Presentation of findings in court is an important aspect of forensic science.
Forensic scientists produce analyses and conclusions that they later explain in court.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: UsageContext: explained during expert witness testimony

remarks: Possessive reference used to infer production relationship.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The truth described is specifically about the challenging cases.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject domain or activity includes the object as one of its important aspects or components.
args.justification: The relation links 'forensic science' to 'presentation of findings' with a part-whole/aspect semantics; a canonical predicate like 'includes_aspect' captures that the presentation of findings is an important aspect of the broader domain of forensic science.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject (typically an agent) creates or generates the object (a product, result, or artifact).
args.justification: The relation describes forensic scientists creating 'analysis and conclusions' before testifying; this is a clear agent-to-produced-artifact relation best modeled with the canonical predicate 'produces'.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject content or statement concerns, focuses on, or is thematically related to the object.
args.justification: The description states that 'the truth described is specifically about the challenging cases'; this is a standard aboutness/subject-matter relation, so 'is_about' is an appropriate canonical predicate.

The link expresses that an aspect/activity (presentation of findings) is a component of a broader domain/practice (forensic science); this fits a class capturing how domains are structured into constituent activities or aspects.

The relation connects human agents (forensic scientists) to the analyses and conclusions they generate, which are knowledge artifacts; a class focusing on creation/production of knowledge artifacts by agents is appropriate.
The semantics is that a statement or truth is about a set of cases; this is best captured by a general aboutness/topic relation class rather than composition or causality.
The relation describes an aspect–whole structure within a domain (forensic science composed of particular aspects like presentation of findings), which is a conceptual part-whole composition.
The key semantics is an agent (forensic scientists) producing an output (analyses and conclusions); this is best grouped under agentive relations rather than pure causality or composition.

The aboutness link associates a piece of content (truth behind challenging cases) with its subject matter (challenging cases); this is a thematic association rather than composition, causality, or identity.
